result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Defendant to repay expense Barron County incurred by SWAT Team when responding to this incident. State to obtain amount within 10 days.
AMENDED 07/11/2016: COURT ORDERS DEFENDANT TO REIMBURSE BARRON COUNTY THE SUM OF $1,289.78.00.

Defendant Brandon J Johnson in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates.  Attorney Harrington relates.  Court contacts Dept of Health & Human Services by telephone to confirm completion of AODA.  Court relates.  State relates.  Attorney Harrington relates. Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail on Thursday, July 7, 2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM.

Defendant Brandon J Johnson in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 2 is Dismissed and Read In.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon J Johnson in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Fees - $50.00 per month by wage assignment beginning 12/15/2015 - Andrew Harrington

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess any firearms.

Defendant Brandon J Johnson in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints Attorney Andrew Harrington to be repaid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing December 15, 2015. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint and pleads NG.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
